intro: Actinea oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leaved actinea, is a perennial flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its opposite arrangement of lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to greenish flowers. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
